posts._title: Rainer Werner Fassbinder – Die Ehe der Maria Braun AKA The Marriage of Maria Braun (1979)
posts.title: Die Ehe der Maria Braun
posts.excerpt: IMDb: This movie follows the life of a young German woman, married to a soldier in the waning days of WWII. Fassbinder has tried to show the gritty life after the end of WWII and the turmoil of the people trapped in its wake.

posts._title: Rainer Werner Fassbinder – Welt am Draht AKA World on a Wire (1973)
posts.title: Welt am Draht
posts.excerpt: SYNOPSIS Based on Daniel F. Galouye’s novel “Simulacron Three” Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s 2 part TV production is a science-fiction classic that explores the notion of a computer-generated other world, pre-dating The Matrix by 26 years. Since its original broadcast in 1973 it has rarely been seen and following increasing demand the Fassbinder Foundation have restored …

posts.title: Querelle
posts.excerpt: Plot Synopsis by Brian J. Dillard (allmovie.com) A sailor learns to take, and give, it like a man in this surrealistic adaptation of writer and thief Jean Genet’s novel Querelle de Brest by avant-garde German director Rainer Werner Fassbinder. In a colorful brothel in the port of Brest, proprietor Nono (Gunther Kaufmann) is known for …

posts._title: Rainer Werner Fassbinder – Götter der Pest AKA Gods of the Plague (1970)
posts.title: Götter der Pest
posts.excerpt: Franz Walsch, a small-time hood, is released from jail and searches for his old acquaintances. He finds his girlfriend Johanna and visits his mother with his brother Marian. Women are attracted to Franz, though he is a man of few words and remains emotionless throughout his encounters with them. Johanna becomes jealous when Franz goes …

posts.title: Les poneyttes
posts.excerpt: Synopsis: Max Thorp, 25, succeeded everything : he manages a famous magazine, a nightclub, a recording studio and a radio station. But high was the price for this success…

posts.title: Slow Action
posts.excerpt: Slow Action is a post-apocalyptic science fiction film which exists somewhere between documentary, ethnographic study and fiction. Slow Action applies the idea of island biogeography – the study of how species and eco-systems evolve differently when isolated and surrounded by unsuitable habitat – to a conception of the Earth in a few hundred years; the …

posts._title: Rainer Werner Fassbinder – Wildwechsel AKA Jail Bait (1973)
posts.title: Wildwechsel
posts.excerpt: Quote: Tonight I saw the infamous Wildwechsel, or Jail Bait, at the Museum of Modern Art. This movie lives up to it’s reputation as one of Rainer Werner Fassbinder’s darkest and most perverse movies. And that’s really saying something. Eva Mattes, age 18, plays Hanni, age 14. Hanni willingly has a sexual relationship with Franz, …

posts._title: Rainer Werner Fassbinder – Der Stadtstreicher AKA The City Tramp (1966)
posts.title: Der Stadtstreicher
posts.excerpt: Description: There is really nothing you could get out of this film. Not even with the weirdest mind. Even some Japanese action director would have made a more believable and satisfying 10 minutes film with this plot line. So is there anything good about it? Yes, if you would look at it as a dream. …

posts._title: Rainer Werner Fassbinder – Frauen in New York AKA Women in New York (1977)
posts.title: Frauen in New York
posts.excerpt: A film version of a play Fassbinder directed in Hamburg, Clare Booth Luce’s “The Women”. It gave Fassbinder an opportunity to indulge his passion for working with women – there are forty women in the play and no men. The play dates from the 1930s, and Fassbinder was accused by the critics of being anti-women …

posts.title: Lili Marleen
posts.excerpt: 1938. Willie (Hanna Schygulla) and Robert (Giancarlo Giannini) are in love: She, a minor German singer who appears in a Zurich nightclub and waits for her big breakthrough. He, son of a rich Jewish family. His father (Mel Ferrer) is the head of an organization that helps Jews flee from Nazi Germany. While he is …
